symptoms.name: Bony pain
symptoms.severity: Variable, can be severe enough to prevent working
symptoms.pattern: Multiple regions, initially nocturnal then continuous

symptoms.name: Skin eruption
symptoms.pattern: Annular, scalene papules and plaques; can be reminiscent of "malignant" syphilis

symptoms.name: Headache
symptoms.pattern: Present in one case, worsening despite analgesics

physical_findings: White, adherent plaques in the mouth
Joint swelling and tenderness at wrist and ankles
Tenderness at anterior tibiae, clavicles, sternum, and forehead

lab_values.rapid_plasma_reagin_(rpr): Elevated (1:64 titer initially, 1:32 after 2 weeks of treatment, 1:8 after 2 months, negative after 9 months in one case; 1:32 in another case)

risk_factors: Lack of regular protection during sexual intercourse

radiography.skull: Negative for bony lesions in one case; ill-defined osteolysis in the vertex in another case

imaging_findings.bone_scintigraphy: Extensive bilateral polyostotic uptake within the hands, feet, forearms, and tibiae/fibulae

ct_scan.head: Lytic osseous lesion in the left parietal bone; additional frontal bone lesions after treatment
ct_scan.chest, abdomen, pelvis: Localized bony osteolytic changes at the sternum and clavicles

mri.head: Corresponding marrow edema and enhancement in the left parietal bone with surrounding enhancing dural and scalp thickening; resolution of soft tissue scalp changes and improved dural thickening with residual marrow edema and enhancement after treatment

required: Characteristic imaging findings (osteolytic lesions on radiography, CT, bone scan)
supportive: Clinical symptoms (bony pain, skin lesions, joint pain)
Histopathological findings (psoriasiform lichenoid dermatitis, spirochetes on modified Steiner stain)

differential_diagnoses: Neoplastic disease (metastases, primary bone tumors, hematological malignancies)
